alert.note: Alert for Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains Between 8500 And 11000 Ft; Southern Sangre De Cristo Mountains Between 7500 and 11000 Ft; Walsenburg Vicinity, Upper Huerfano River Basin Below 7500 Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 17 at 4:28PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Huerfano and northeastern Costilla Counties through 500 PM MDT... At 428 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near La Veta, or near Spring Burn Scar south of Highway 160 in Huerfano county, moving northwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Spring Burn Scar north of Highway 160, northern Spring Burn Scar south of Highway 160 in Huerfano county, northern Spring Burn Scar south of Highway 160 in Costilla county, La Veta and La Veta Pass. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains Between 8500 And 11000 Ft; Southern Sangre De Cristo Mountains Between 7500 and 11000 Ft; Walsenburg Vicinity, Upper Huerfano River Basin Below 7500 Ft
